channel.title: Okkkay, little problem with Portforwarding (Not the average)
channel.description:
Okay, so, I HAVE portforwarded correctly before, just on a different router. This one's strange... Instead of like, Linksys or something, it's a WIFI connection. It's a Dell Wireless 1397 WLAN Mini-Card.
Okay, so, the options it has for anything to do with Ports when I connect to 192.168.1.1 are Port Forwarding and Port Filtering.
Instead of being able to make new Applications in Port Forwarding, theirs pre-set ones. Ex; DNS. Then, they have the "IP Address on WLAN" column.
Then, the Port Filtering apparently just allows any port if disabled, but when enabled, only allows the selected ones (Theirs an option here for a custom port to be allowed) I HAVE tried to enable Port Filtering and then add a custom port 43594 to be allowed, which also didn't work.
If you got any suggestions that you could give me, that'd be greatly appreciated. I really want to be able to use this internet connection as a secondary source in case my main Linksys internet goes down:\

item.title: Okkkay, little problem with Portforwarding (Not the average)
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

You can use uTorrent to portforward.

Read full topic

item.title: Okkkay, little problem with Portforwarding (Not the average)
item.dc:creator: @kid2kewl2bereal kid2kewl2bereal
item.description:
@kid2kewl2bereal wrote:

Okay, so, I HAVE portforwarded correctly before, just on a different router. This one’s strange… Instead of like, Linksys or something, it’s a WIFI connection. It’s a Dell Wireless 1397 WLAN Mini-Card.

Okay, so, the options it has for anything to do with Ports when I connect to 192.168.1.1 are Port Forwarding and Port Filtering.

Instead of being able to make new Applications in Port Forwarding, theirs pre-set ones. Ex; DNS. Then, they have the “IP Address on WLAN” column.

Then, the Port Filtering apparently just allows any port if disabled, but when enabled, only allows the selected ones (Theirs an option here for a custom port to be allowed) I HAVE tried to enable Port Filtering and then add a custom port 43594 to be allowed, which also didn’t work.

If you got any suggestions that you could give me, that’d be greatly appreciated. I really want to be able to use this internet connection as a secondary source in case my main Linksys internet goes down:\
